snippet: In a rare interview on NBC’s “Meet the Press,” Mitt Romney offered praise for some of President Obama’s policies, and said he would retain some aspects of his health care overhaul.
abstract: Mitt Romney, in rare interview with NBC's 'Meet the Press,' offers praise for some of Pres Obama's policies and says he would retain some aspects of his health care overhaul; shift to a more bipartisan tone appears to be aimed at attracting key middle-of-the road voters; police officer escorting Pres Obama's motorcade in Florida is killed when he is hit by a pickup truck.

byline.contributor: Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Fort Pierce, Fla.; Rachel L. Swarns from Washington; and Jim Rutenberg from New York.

lead_paragraph: In a rare interview on NBC’s “Meet the Press,” Mitt Romney offered praise for some of President Obama’s policies, and said he would retain some aspects of his health care overhaul.

headline.seo: Romney Adopts Softer Tone in Critique of Obama
headline.main: Romney, Easing, Says Health Law Isn’t All Bad
headline.print_headline: Romney, Easing, Says Health Law Isn’t All Bad

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
